channel.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
channel.description:
I know it says its [b]REALLY FREE[/b] but really whats the catch?
[img]http://i.imgur.com/gyATtIV.png[/img]

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:24, topic:551762”][quote author=Travas link=topic=670677.msg4485598#msg4485598 date=1433801852]

[quote author=lawl link=topic=670677.msg4485577#msg4485577 date=1433795491]
If I didn’t get the notification yet, will I ever get it? My windows is legit
[/quote]http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_10-win_upgrade/i-want-to-reserve-my-free-copy-of-windows-10-but-i/848b5cce-958b-49ae-a132-a999a883265b

If I didn’t get the notification yet, will I ever get it? My windows is legit

Make sure you ran Windows update and are on the latest updates…
Mine isn’t legit but ima try running the updater and see if it shows up for me. Doubt it but doesn’t hurt to try.
[/quote]You should still be able to update to windows 10 for free, but it will remain a pirated copy until you buy the necessary key.

The site said that the button to get a free copy shouldn’t show up on non-genuine computers…
[/quote][quote=“Microsoft”][font=verdana]Although non-Genuine PCs might be able to upgrade to Windows 10, the upgrade will not change the genuine state of the license. This applies across geographies. Customers that are improperly licensed before the upgrade will be improperly licensed after the upgrade. We will provide a mechanism for non-genuine Windows 10 PC devices to “get genuine” via the new Windows Store, whether they are upgraded versions of Windows or purchased. We will have details on this as we get closer to launch.[/font][/quote]Maybe the button won’t appear for you, but you will be able to upgrade when 10 comes out.

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:23, topic:551762”][quote author=lawl link=topic=670677.msg4485577#msg4485577 date=1433795491]
If I didn’t get the notification yet, will I ever get it? My windows is legit
[/quote]http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_10-win_upgrade/i-want-to-reserve-my-free-copy-of-windows-10-but-i/848b5cce-958b-49ae-a132-a999a883265b

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670677.msg4485594#msg4485594 date=1433800092]

If I didn’t get the notification yet, will I ever get it? My windows is legit

Make sure you ran Windows update and are on the latest updates…
Mine isn’t legit but ima try running the updater and see if it shows up for me. Doubt it but doesn’t hurt to try.
[/quote]You should still be able to update to windows 10 for free, but it will remain a pirated copy until you buy the necessary key.[/quote]
The site said that the button to get a free copy shouldn’t show up on non-genuine computers…

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:19, topic:551762”][quote author=Sessy Pk3r link=topic=670677.msg4484671#msg4484671 date=1433181554]
Subscription model on an operating system. I hope this idea flops.
[/quote]
it’s not a subscription system, people misunderstood when microsoft said it would be a “free [upgrade] for one year”

after a year, OR for any new pcs sold with win10, it will of course cost the standard windows license[/quote]The reason I thought it was a subscription was because I actually talked to a microsoft employee and he said that microsoft was moving to subscription based models for a lot of it’s software and thought it might happen to Windows too; to be fair he works in their like web analysis department but he knew it was happening to a lot of their stuff

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Sessy Pk3r:

Subscription model on an operating system. I hope this idea flops.

it’s not a subscription system, people misunderstood when microsoft said it would be a “free [upgrade] for one year”

after a year, OR for any new pcs sold with win10, it will of course cost the standard windows license

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:3, topic:551762”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=670677.msg4484608#msg4484608 date=1433135174]
The (supposed) catch is that Windows 10 is going to have a free trial option for everyone, or a subscription rate instead of a flat rate. We’ll see, so far everything has indicated the free windows 10 upgrade to be completely legit, even if it ends up only being for one year.
[/quote]
unless it gives you the option to downgrade back down once the “free trial” is up, its a pretty big catch[/quote]

supposedly the catch is that it invalidates your flexible multi-install win7/8 keys to a fixed hardware win10 install, I’m not sure if you can downgrade or format from scratch

[quote=“Chassy13, post:11, topic:551762”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=670677.msg4484667#msg4484667 date=1433180828]
Do you have a source for the forced updates? I heard that it’s like that currently because it’s in testing and they want everyone on the same build, but I haven’t seen where they said it was going to stay that way. As for candy crush, they had pre-installed games on other versions of windows as well, as long as you’re able to uninstall it easily I don’t think that’ll be the dealbreaker for me
[/quote]

That actually makes complete sense for the forced updating. I had not read that. Thank you for clarifying. Bloatware is an inconvenience at most, and the lesser the better. But correct me if I am wrong, Microsoft never defaulted mass-revenue games to their installs in other releases.[/quote]

pinball came with xp and some earlier versions and it was a retail game at the time, some shit came with vista also

Lin:

[quote]More annoyingly, perhaps, Microsoft has also changed how updates will work with Windows 10. Although the Pro and Enterprise editions will both be able to defer updates, Windows 10 Home users will not have the option. Updates will instead be downloaded and installed automatically as soon as they’re available.[/quote]

I will be completely surprised if when win10 releases people won’t be able to disable automatic updates, some people simply do not have the data bandwidth or caps for ms to force whatever shit they want down user’s throats

I’m really disappointed that 99% of ‘tech news’ type sites are just parroting what microsoft say and aren’t harassing microsoft for what is essentially forced adware or potentially forcing computers to brick with dodgy updates

but then again, given the whole win10 preview keylogger fiasco where a dozen sites tried to claim it was no big deal, I wouldn’t be surprised if no one makes a big fuss when microsoft do force updates to be able to show ads on the startbar or something

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

They keep repeating it’s totally free for those who upgrade in the first year, no catch, it’s not a subscription. I don’t really see why it’s hard to believe, Microsoft are far more interested in getting people in their ecosystem at the moment than the extra revenue they’d get from a years worth of (home) sales.

They don’t want another XP situation where no one upgrades (with Windows 7).

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

OS X is also Apple PC’s only selling point. Without it they wouldn’t (shouldn’t) be able to sell a single computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“malimt, post:15, topic:551762”]Tried the beta and it’s pretty cool. It’s actually for free!
They are doing pretty much the same thing as Mac OS X…
They came up with the idea of free upgrade for their users.
OS X (Yosemite) is a free upgrade for every Mac user, :p[/quote]Completely different situation with the apple operating systems, considering you’re paying for the computer itself all to the same company I would hope they would give you software updates for free. Microsoft makes its money from the OS itself, not the hardware, so it’s a lot different for them to be giving free updates.

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

Tried the beta and it’s pretty cool. It’s actually for free!
They are doing pretty much the same thing as Mac OS X…
They came up with the idea of free upgrade for their users.
OS X (Yosemite) is a free upgrade for every Mac user,

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I hope that means updates wont force restart anymore. If it does that’s really annoying.

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

More annoyingly, perhaps, Microsoft has also changed how updates will work with Windows 10. Although the Pro and Enterprise editions will both be able to defer updates, Windows 10 Home users will not have the option. Updates will instead be downloaded and installed automatically as soon as they're available.

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I may be wrong but I think I remember for a while some versions of Vista (heh) came with the Popcap Games launcher installed or something. But yeah, so far I really like the new features in 10, as long as it’s not too bloaty I think I’ll take my upgrades for my PCs

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Davidi2:

Do you have a source for the forced updates? I heard that it’s like that currently because it’s in testing and they want everyone on the same build, but I haven’t seen where they said it was going to stay that way. As for candy crush, they had pre-installed games on other versions of windows as well, as long as you’re able to uninstall it easily I don’t think that’ll be the dealbreaker for me

That actually makes complete sense for the forced updating. I had not read that. Thank you for clarifying. Bloatware is an inconvenience at most, and the lesser the better. But correct me if I am wrong, Microsoft never defaulted mass-revenue games to their installs in other releases.

I haven’t been following this close enough to really make a sound decision. I can’t even justify an opinion about Windows 8, as I use Windows 7 at both home and work, but I do know my way around Windows 8. Right now it’s just a stir of opinions and geek-brawling. I am sure that within a couple of weeks there will be much more information.

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Sessy_Pk3r Sessy Pk3r

Subscription model on an operating system. I hope this idea flops.

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:6, topic:551762”]All I know is that you will be unable to opt out of Windows 10 updates. They’ll also shove some sell-out bloatware at you, such as Crandy Crush and any other large titles they desire.[/quote]Do you have a source for the forced updates? I heard that it’s like that currently because it’s in testing and they want everyone on the same build, but I haven’t seen where they said it was going to stay that way. As for candy crush, they had pre-installed games on other versions of windows as well, as long as you’re able to uninstall it easily I don’t think that’ll be the dealbreaker for me

Read full topic

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

I’ve heard this and that reviews about Windows 10, I’m not sure how I feel about it. Let alone not being able to go right back to 8, it’d kill me.

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10

item.title: Free upgrade to windows 10
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

All I know is that you will be unable to opt out of Windows 10 updates. They’ll also shove some sell-out bloatware at you, such as Crandy Crush and any other large titles they desire.

I’m open to experiment but I’d prefer if a quick option to revert back to 7 was available. I’ll likely sign up to have it download and then do more research closer to July. I am sure a lot of creditable websites will be all over this soon.

Read full topic
